file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 05-30-01-06 - NOSE LANDING GEAR - EXTERNAL - INSPECTION/CHECK

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NOSE LANDING GEAR - EXTERNAL - INSPECTION/CHECK EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the visual inspection of the nose landing gear, gear compartment LH/RH doors, nose landing gear bay and FWD pressure bulkhead lower side for general condition. B. Related zones: 711/713/714/113/114/115/116. C. Zone Boundaries: STA X = 713 thru STA X = 2159.0. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY NOSE LANDING GEAR - EXTERNAL GEN- ALL 05-30-01-200-801-A ♦ ERAL VISUAL INSPECTION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 05-30-01 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 05-30-01-200-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. NOSE LANDING GEAR - EXTERNAL GENERAL VISUAL INSPECTION A. General (1) This task gives instructions to do Zonal Task 32-Z711-213-001-A00. (2) You must do the external general visual inspection (GVI) of the nose landing gear, gear compartment LH/RH doors, nose landing gear bay and FWD pressure bulkhead lower side, in zones 711/713/714/113/114/115/116, at a distance from which you can touch the items that you will examine. (3) The function of the external visual inspection (GVI) is to find damage, failure, or irregular conditions that can be easily seen. (4) After you complete the procedures given in the Zonal Inspection task, you must do a General Visual Inspection (GVI) in all of the specified zones. The inspection must include all installations, components, and structures. Refer to the AMM Introduction for zonal inspection criteria. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200 LG SAFETY PIN - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL WM 20-22-00 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Nose landing gear I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Install the landing-gear safety pin ( AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 05-30-01 Page 2 of 4 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. External General Visual Inspection (Figure 601) SUBTASK 212-002-A (1) Examine the nose landing gear zone for loose rivets, screws, nicks, cracks, dents, erosion, corrosion, deformation, deteriorated protective treatment, signs of leakage, and boding jumper condition. (2) Examine the extension and retraction components of the nose landing gear for condition. (3) Examine the nose landing gear doors for condition. (4) Examine the nose landing gear door hinge points for condition. (5) Examine the lower locking strut for condition. (6) Examine the NLG bay area and FWD pressure bulkhead lower side for loose rivets, screws, nicks, cracks, dents, corrosion, deformation, deteriorated protective treatment. (7) Examine the EWIS components for signs of damage, adequate installation, chafing and general condition. Refer to WM 20-22-00. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Remove the landing gear safety pin ( AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200).
